authors: Division of Infectious Diseases, The Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, The Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania , Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
text: Rotavirus is the most important cause of gastroenteritis worldwide. In developing countries, the virus is a major cause of death in infants and young children. In the United States, before the licensure of vaccines, rotavirus infections accounted for ∼2.7 million cases of gastroenteritis annually. Here are described the history and challenges surrounding the development of a rotavirus vaccine.
title: Challenges to Developing a Rotavirus Vaccine.
